q: Why compare yourself with others? No one in the entire world can do a better job of being you than you.
h:
“Why compare yourself with others? No one in the entire world can do a better job of being you than you.” —
Unknown

q: Don't stop when you're tired. Stop when you're done.
h:
“Don't stop when you're tired. Stop when you're done.” —
Marilyn Monroe

q: People who bite the hand that feeds them usually lick the boot that kicks them.
h:
“People who bite the hand that feeds them usually lick the boot that kicks them.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: To be of use to the world is the only way to be happy.
h:
“To be of use to the world is the only way to be happy.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: Less is more.
h:
“Less is more.” —
Robert Browning

q: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
h:
“A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.” —
Mark Twain

q: If you're afraid - don't do it, - if you're doing it - don't be afraid!
h:
“If you're afraid - don't do it, - if you're doing it - don't be afraid! ” —
Genghis Khan

q: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
h:
“Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.” —
Dalai Lama

q: The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.
h:
“The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.” —
Brian Tracy

q: The only reason to be alive is to enjoy it.
h:
“The only reason to be alive is to enjoy it.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: Creativity is the greatest rebellion in existence.
h:
“Creativity is the greatest rebellion in existence.” —
Osho

q: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.
h:
“Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.” —
Ayn Rand

q: We forge the chains we wear in life.
h:
“We forge the chains we wear in life.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Wrong does not cease to be wrong because the majority share in it.
h:
“Wrong does not cease to be wrong because the majority share in it.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: Silence is the great teacher and to learn its lessons you must pay attention to it.
h:
“Silence is the great teacher and to learn its lessons you must pay attention to it.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: You can put lipstick on a pig. It's still a pig.
h:
“You can put lipstick on a pig. It's still a pig.” —
Barack Obama

q: I cannot make my days longer so I strive to make them better.
h:
“I cannot make my days longer so I strive to make them better.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.
h:
“Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.” —
Bob Marley

q: The future doesn't belong to the faint-hearted; it belongs to the brave.
h:
“The future doesn't belong to the faint-hearted; it belongs to the brave.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Even if our home burns down we can rebuild it. But the things that we got for nothing, we can never replace.
h:
“Even if our home burns down we can rebuild it. But the things that we got for nothing, we can never replace.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Someday death will take us to another star.
h:
“Someday death will take us to another star.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
h:
“If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.” —
Lao Tzu

q: The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.
h:
“The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.
h:
“A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: Never buy a thing you do not want, because it is cheap, it will be dear to you.
h:
“Never buy a thing you do not want, because it is cheap, it will be dear to you.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.
h:
“The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.” —
Lin Yutang

q: Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.
h:
“Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.” —
Anne Frank

q: Don't be afraid to see what you see.
h:
“Don't be afraid to see what you see.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
h:
“Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack. ” —
Seneca

q: Zen insists that the whole trouble is just our failure to realize that there is no problem.
h:
“Zen insists that the whole trouble is just our failure to realize that there is no problem.” —
Bruce Lee

q: Short cuts make long delays.
h:
“Short cuts make long delays.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Conscience is a dog that does not stop us from passing but that we cannot prevent from barking.
h:
“Conscience is a dog that does not stop us from passing but that we cannot prevent from barking.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: We will now discuss in a little more detail the Struggle for Existence.
h:
“We will now discuss in a little more detail the Struggle for Existence.” —
Charles Darwin

q: Do not allow your inner doubts to keep you from achieving what you can do.
h:
“Do not allow your inner doubts to keep you from achieving what you can do.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Never give way to laziness.
h:
“Never give way to laziness.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: A hut full of laughter is richer than a palace full of sadness.
h:
“A hut full of laughter is richer than a palace full of sadness.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.
h:
“Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

q: What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.
h:
“What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.” —
Unknown

q: Relax. Nothing is under control.
h:
“Relax. Nothing is under control.” —
Adi Da Samraj

q: Mastery is not a function of genius or talent, it is a function of time and intense focus applied to a particular field of knowledge.
h:
“Mastery is not a function of genius or talent, it is a function of time and intense focus applied to a particular field of knowledge.” —
Robert Greene

q: The important thing is not what one is born with but what use one makes of that equipment.
h:
“The important thing is not what one is born with but what use one makes of that equipment.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Get mad, then get over it.
h:
“Get mad, then get over it.” —
Colin Powell

q: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.
h:
“If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Great things happen to those who don't stop believing, trying, learning, and being grateful.
h:
“Great things happen to those who don't stop believing, trying, learning, and being grateful.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.
h:
“The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.” —
William James

q: For things to change, you have to change.
h:
“For things to change, you have to change.” —
Jim Rohn

q: The destiny of man is in his own soul.
h:
“The destiny of man is in his own soul. ” —
Herodotus

q: You are the only problem you will ever have and you are the only solution.
h:
“You are the only problem you will ever have and you are the only solution.” —
Bob Proctor

q: Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.
h:
“Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
h:
“We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.” —
Benjamin Franklin
